com.analog.lyric.options

Interface IOptionHolder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDataEventSource, IDimpleEventSource, IDiscreteSolverVariable, IJunctionTreeSolverVariable<Delegate>, IModelEventSource, INode, IProxyDiscreteSolverVariable<Delegate>, IProxySolverNode<Delegate>, IProxySolverVariable<Delegate>, ISolverBlastFromThePastFactor, ISolverEventSource, ISolverFactor, ISolverFactorGibbs, ISolverFactorGraph, ISolverNode, ISolverNodeGibbs, ISolverVariable, ISolverVariableGibbs

    public interface IOptionHolder
    Interface for object that can hold option values.

    Concrete implementations will typically extend either LocalOptionHolder or StatelessOptionHolder.

    • Method Detail

      • clearLocalOptions

        void clearLocalOptions()
        Clears all local options.

        Unsets all options set directly on this object. This does not affect option settings on other option holders in the delegate chain.

      • getLocalOptions

        java.util.Collection<IOption<? extends java.io.Serializable>> getLocalOptions()
        Read-only collection describing options that are set directly on this object.

        This does not include options set on delegates.

        Since:
        0.07

      • getOptionDelegates

        ReleasableIterator<? extends IOptionHolder> getOptionDelegates()
        Iterates over option holders in order in of lookup precedence.

        This should be the first object returned by the iterator.

        The default implementation provided by AbstractOptionHolder returns a OptionParentIterator instance, which simply walks up the chain of option parents.

        Since:
        0.07

      • getOptionParent

        @Nullable
IOptionHolder getOptionParent()
        The "parent" of this option holder to which option lookup will be delegated for option keys that are not set on this object. Used by getOption(IOptionKey).

        Implementors should ensure that chain of parents is not circular!

        Returns:
        the parent object or null if there is none.

      • getOptionOrDefault

        <T extends java.io.Serializable> T getOptionOrDefault(IOptionKey<T> key)
        Returns value of option with given key or else its default value.

        The same as getOption(com.analog.lyric.options.IOptionKey<T>) but returns the key's defaultValue instead of null if option is not set.

        Parameters:
        key - is a non-null option key.
        Since:
        0.07

      • getOption

        @Nullable
<T extends java.io.Serializable> T getOption(IOptionKey<T> key)
        Returns value of option with given key if set, else null.

        Returns the value of the first option setting found in this object or in its list of delegates. Specifically it invokes getLocalOption(com.analog.lyric.options.IOptionKey<T>) on each object in getOptionDelegates() and returns the first non-null result.

        Parameters:
        key - is a non-null option key.
        Since:
        0.07

      • getLocalOption

        @Nullable
<T extends java.io.Serializable> T getLocalOption(IOptionKey<T> key)
        Returns value of option with given key if set directly on this object, else null.

        Parameters:
        key - is a non-null option key.
        Since:
        0.07

      • setOption

        <T extends java.io.Serializable> void setOption(IOptionKey<T> key,
                                              T value)
        Sets option locally with given key to specified value.

        Parameters:
        key - is a non-null option key.
        value - is a non-null value with type compatible with key's type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if implementation does not support local option storage.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if implementation does not support local option storage for given key.
        Since:
        0.07

      • supportsLocalOptions

        boolean supportsLocalOptions()
        Indicates whether object supports local storage of options.

        If true, then option values may be set directly on this object using the setOption(com.analog.lyric.options.IOptionKey<T>, T) method; otherwise that method will throw an exception.

        Since:
        0.07

      • unsetOption

        void unsetOption(IOptionKey<?> key)
        Unsets local option with given key.

        Removes option setting on this object for given key if such a setting exists. This does not affect option settings on other objects.

        Parameters:
        key - is a non-null option key.
        Since:
        0.07
